result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Declined by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on October 18th, 2022 - "The defendant and his attorney did not appear for the hearing. The State objected to the request."

11:00 AM Defendant Kevin M Jolitz not in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton not in court. Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim not appearing.
Court finds motion was filed by Atty. Singleton.  State would object to any modification of the bond conditions.  Court takes no action.  Date remains as previously set.
Per order of Judge Dorow, the affidavit filed on 10/7/2022 is sealed, and the defense is to file another affidavit that complies with Marsy's Law.

of Victim A, filed by Attorney Singleton.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/12/2022 - The defense is required to file an affidavit that complies with Marsy's Law, no later than Friday, 10/14/2022. This original version will remain under seal due to victim's rights.**

Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty Singleton.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/11/2022 - Due to the trial in Branch 2, this motion may be set in front of a court commissioner.**

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant to have no contact with Donnie Boy's Bar/Victim A (with the exception of contact through Our Family Wizard)/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

8:16 AM Defendant Kevin M Jolitz in court.  Attorney Kevin James for attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Kevin M Jolitz.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
